thread.title: Vigil tonight in memory of teacher, daughter killed in Turnpike crash
thread.title_full: Vigil tonight in memory of teacher, daughter killed in Turnpike crash

author: Caitlin Mota | The Jersey Journal
title: Vigil tonight in memory of teacher, daughter killed in Turnpike crash
text:
comments 
BAYONNE - One year after a beloved Hudson County Prep teacher and his 5-year-old daughter were killed in a horrific car crash, friends and family will hold a candlelight vigil in their memory tonight. 
Tim and Bridget O'Donnell were rear-ended as their Chevrolet Impala approached the 14A toll plaza on Feb. 22, 2016 . Scott Hahn, of Hamilton, was allegedly drugged at the time of the crash and was charged in connection with their deaths. 
A memorial, with a balloon and bubble release, is scheduled for 6 p.m. at the Stephen R. Gregg Hudson County Park softball fields. 
Tim O'Donnell, 48, taught math and science at the Montgomery Street school. He spent countless hours coaching softball at County Prep and Hudson Catholic high schools. Bridget had dreams of becoming a "cancer curing singing doctor," her mother said. 
Caitlin Mota may be reached at . Follow her on Twitter @caitlin_mota . Find The Jersey Journal on Facebook.
